text: I actually grew up in Japan (spent the first 4 years of my life there; 1992-1996) and I grew up watching pretty much the entirety of DBZ there and GT just began when I shifted back home to India. The series ran from 1989 to 1996; the 3rd game was based in the Buu, etc. arc.

text: @Luigi84289 I have to kinda agree with you. The best half of the series is the first halv. The fights with Nappa and Vegeta is my favourite part. The one with Freezer is damn good too. Towards the end of the series it gets kinda ridiculous. They can blow up the entire universe by just thinking :) Also, the villians become kinda stock, every damn villian is "PURE EVIL" and wants to destroy the entire universe. My favourite book is probably nr 19.

author: AdeyAdey

text: I had all the Butouden games as a kid but #2 is the one I played and liked the most. I've always been more of a Street Fighter player when it comes to fighting games, but this series' take on the genre was refreshing since they battle arenas were a lot bigger and open world. That and pulling off superpowers like Kamehamehas always felt awesome.
author: SupraDarky
